member.name: T:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailValidator
member.summary: Performs validation on instances by checking if they contain valid e-mail addresses.
member.remarks:
This validator can be configured through code or through the configuration file. By default all domains and /or IP addresses are considered valid as long as their syntax is correct (note that IP addresses will only be considered valid if is set to ).
To specifically include or exclude domains or IP addresses, two approaches can be used.
Code By setting the and/or properties, the white and black list of valid domains or IP addresses can be manipulated. To specify multiple domains, separate the domains with a semi colon (';'). When setting both the and the properties, the values in takes precedence over the values in .
Configuration
All properties of the except for the property can be set through configuration. First of all, the configuration section must be specified:
<configuration> <configSections> <section name="Enkoni.Validators" type="Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.Configuration.ValidatorsSection, Enkoni.Framework.Validation"/> </configSections> </configuration>
Then inside the section, the validator can be configured:
<Enkoni.Validators> <EmailValidator allowComments="false" allowIPAddresses="false" requireTopLevelDomain="false"> <includeDomains> <domain pattern="microsoft.com" /> <domain pattern="live.nl" /> <!-- Wildcards can be used to specify multiple domains. The wildcards * and ? are supported --> <domain pattern="*.be" /> </includeDomains> <excludeDomains> <domain pattern="yahoo.com" /> <domain pattern="gmail.com" /> <!-- Wildcards can be used to specify multiple domains. The wildcards * and ? are supported --> <domain pattern="yahoo.be" /> </excludeDomains> </EmailValidator> </Enkoni.Validators>
It is also possible to specify multiple configurations for different instances of validators by specifying the name attribute. At most one nameless validator can be specified in the configuration. The nameless configuration will be used by validators that do not have a name specified or whose name is not explicitly configured.
<Enkoni.Validators> <!-- Since this validator does not have a name specified, it will be used as the default configuration --> <EmailValidator allowComments="false" allowIPAdresses="false" /> <!-- This configuration will only be applied to validators with the name "MyValidator" --> <EmailValidator name="MyValidator" allowComments="false" allowIPAddresses="true"> <includeDomains> <!--The add-tag can be used to include area codes --> <domain pattern="192.168.*" /> </includeDomains> </EmailValidator> </Enkoni.Validators>

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailValidator.DefaultName

member.name: T:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories
member.summary: Defines the supported categories of phone numbers for the .

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.None
member.summary: Match no phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Regular
member.summary: Match only regular phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Mobile
member.summary: Match only mobile phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Service
member.summary: Match only service phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Emergency
member.summary: Match only emergency phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Other
member.summary: Match phone numbers that to not fall into the other categories.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.Default
member.summary: Match regular and mobile phone numbers.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.PhoneNumberCategories.All
member.summary: Match all phone numbers.

member.name: T:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailCategory
member.summary: Defines the supported categories of e-mail addresses for the .

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailCategory.Basic
member.summary: Match basic e-mail addresses only. Basic e-mail addresses may contain alfa numeric characters and the '-' and '_' characters.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailCategory.Extended
member.summary: Match all e-mail addresses except e-mail addresses that contain quoted strings.

member.name: F:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.EmailCategory.Complete
member.summary: Match all e-mail addresses according to RFC5322.

member.name: T:Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.DutchPhoneNumberValidator
member.summary: Performs validation on instances by checking if they contain valid Dutch phone numbers.
member.remarks:
This validator can be configured through code or through the configuration file. When the validator is configured to include the category (which is the default setting), all area codes that are valid according to the Dutch 'numbering plan for phone and ISDN services' that was published at November 12th 2013 (link).
To override the validated area codes, two approaches can be used.
Code By setting the and/or properties, the collection of valid area codes can be manipulated. To specify multiple area codes, separate the area codes with a semi colon (';'). When setting the property, the default list of valid area codes will be ignored and only the specified area codes will be considered valid. Eg. when setting to "010;020;030", only phone numbers with those area codes will be considered valid.
Configuration
All properties of the except for the property can be set through configuration. First of all, the configuration section must be specified:
<configuration> <configSections> <section name="Enkoni.Validators" type="Enkoni.Framework.Validation.Validators.Configuration.ValidatorsSection, Enkoni.Framework.Validation"/> </configSections> </configuration>
Then inside the section, the validator can be configured:
<Enkoni.Validators> <DutchPhoneNumberValidator allowCountryCallingCode="false" allowCarrierPreselect="true"> <areaCodes> <clear /> <!-- The clear-tag is optional and will reset the default collection of area codes --> <!--The add-tag can be used to include area codes --> <add areaCode="010" /> <add areaCode="020" /> <add areaCode="030" /> <!-- The remove-tag can be used to exclude area codes --> <remove areaCode="023" /> <remove areaCode="058" /> </areaCodes> </DutchPhoneNumberValidator> </Enkoni.Validators>
It is also possible to specify multiple configurations for different instances of validators by specifying the name attribute. At most one nameless validator can be specified in the configuration. The nameless configuration will be used by validators that do not have a name specified or whose name is not explicitly configured.
<Enkoni.Validators> <!-- Since this validator does not have a name specified, it will be used as the default configuration --> <DutchPhoneNumberValidator allowCountryCallingCode="false" allowCarrierPreselect="true"> <areaCodes> <clear /> <!-- The clear-tag is optional and will reset the default collection of area codes --> <!--The add-tag can be used to include area codes --> <add areaCode="010" /> <add areaCode="020" /> <add areaCode="030" /> <!-- The remove-tag can be used to exclude area codes --> <remove areaCode="023" /> <remove areaCode="058" /> </areaCodes> </DutchPhoneNumberValidator> <!-- This configuration will only be applied to validators with the name "MyValidator" --> <DutchPhoneNumberValidator name="MyValidator" allowCountryCallingCode="false" allowCarrierPreselect="true"> <areaCodes> <clear /> <!-- The clear-tag is optional and will reset the default collection of area codes --> <!--The add-tag can be used to include area codes --> <add areaCode="010" /> <add areaCode="020" /> <add areaCode="030" /> <!-- The remove-tag can be used to exclude area codes --> <remove areaCode="023" /> <remove areaCode="058" /> </areaCodes> </DutchPhoneNumberValidator> </Enkoni.Validators>
